headline: Campbell’s price target lowered to $40 from $47 at Stifel
summary: Stifel lowered the firm’s price target on Campbell’s (CPB) to $40 from $47 and keeps a Hold rating on the shares. The firm, which maintains a Neutral weighting for the Food group, says the group’s valuation discount to historical levels is primarily reflecting the weak revenue outlook and reinvestment requirements pressuring margins. While valuation remains compelling in relation to history for the food stocks, the firm remains cautious given the uncertainty in revenue growth pacing in 2025, not
